meanings.definition: The layer of cells in the eye of vertebrates that reflects light and enhances night vision.
meanings.sent1: The tapetums in the eyes of animals like cats help them see better in the dark.
meanings.sent2: Nocturnal animals rely on their tapetums to see clearly at night.
meanings.sent3: The tapetums in the eyes of owls make them look like they have glowing eyes in the dark.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes shone like tapetums in the dimly lit room, revealing her excitement.
meanings.sent5: The tapetums in the eyes of wolves give them an advantage when hunting in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: The reflective layer in the eyes of some animals that helps them see in low light conditions.
meanings.sent1: The tapetums of certain animals reflect light to improve their vision in the dark.
meanings.sent2: Cats' tapetums allow them to see clearly in dim light.
meanings.sent3: The tapetums in the eyes of raccoons make them look like they have glowing eyes at night.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like tapetums, capturing the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The tapetums in the eyes of deer give them an advantage when foraging in the twilight.
